intro: Campuloclinium tubaraoense, commonly known as the Tubarão grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Due to its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh conditions, it is often found in dune ecosystems and coastal areas.
